intro: Geostachys maliauensis, commonly known as the Maliauensis geostachys, is a rare flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers that bloom during the wet season. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its unique floral structure and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires further study to ensure its survival.
